Authors:
Lina Liu, Guoying Zhou, Airong Shen, Baoming Shen, Yun Tan,
Zhuming Tan
Title:
Mycena subpiligera sp. nov., a symbiotic species from China
associated with the seed germination of Gastrodia elata
Keywords:
Gastrodia elata, germination, Mycena, new taxon,
basidiomata formation
Abstract:
Mycena subpiligera, a new taxon in sect. Fragilipedes
which can highly enhance the germination efficiency of Gastrodia elata
seeds, was discovered in subtropical areas of China. Morphological
characters compared with related Mycena species and phylogenetic
analyses conducted based on the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and
the large subunit (LSU) regions of nuclear ribosomal RNA gene sequences
with Maximum Likelihood (ML) and Bayesian Analysis (BA) tree show that
the new taxon can be distinguished from phenotypically similar and
phylogenetically related species. Optimal cultural conditions on
basidiomata formation of this new taxon and comparison germination rates
with M. citrinomarginata are also presented in this paper.
